intro: Glochidion longipedicellatum, commonly known as the long-stemmed glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems that often have a rough texture. It typically grows in tropical rainforests and is often found in secondary vegetation. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
